sentences: Tema oli hea 천petaja. Tema olnud hea 천petaja. Tema olemas olnud hea 천petaja.
context: "olid" is the past tense form of the Estonian verb "olema" (to be). It specifically represents the simple past tense, equivalent to English "was" or "were". This word is used when describing a state that existed in the past but has now ended. For example, "Tema oli hea 천petaja" means "He was a good teacher." The word can also appear in compound tenses like perfect tense with auxiliary verbs.
